Comment.Language: The veil of the Sanctuary is opened, the candles are lit, and the black curtains are removed and replaced by red curtains befitting of Joyous Saturday.

Text.Language: The prophecies of the Twelfth Hour of Great Friday of Holy Pascha. May its blessings be with us. Amen.
نبوات الساعة الثانية عشر من يوم الجمعة العظيمة من البصخة المقدسة بركته علينا. آمين.

Comment.Language: The Lamentation of Jeremiah is chanted in its Paschal “lamenting” tune.

Text.Language: Anok v~rwmi a~nok eynau e~]meth/ki: afi~ e~h~r/i e~jwi qen pis~bwt n~te pefjwnt. Afa~moni m~moi ouoh afolt e~qoun e~ou,aki e~ouwini an: p~l/n aftacyo n~tefjij n~q~r/i n~q/t m~pie~hoou t/rf.
"I am the man who sees poverty by the rod of His anger upon me. He took me and led me away into darkness, and not into light. Surely He has turned His hand against me throughout the day.
أنا هو الرجل الذى رأى الـمـذلة. أتى علـىّ بقضيـب غضبه وقادنى وسـيـرنى فـى الظلمة لا فى النـور. والآن رد يـده عـلىّ النهار كله.
Afyreclwm n~je tacarx nem pasar: afqomqem n~nakac. Afkw] e~roi ouoh afw~rf n~taa~ve e~qoun: Aft~hemkoi qen hanma n~,aki: aft~hemcoi e~q~r/i m~v~r/] n~hanrefmwou ne~neh.
"He has aged my flesh and my skin and has broken my bones. He has besieged me and surrounded my head; He has worn me down with hardships. He set me in dark places as those long dead.
أبلى لحمى وجلدى وسحق عظامى. أحاط بى ونكس رأسى، وأذلنى وأجلسنى فى مواضع مظلمة، مثل الموتى من قديم.

"He hedged me in, and I cannot come forth; He made my brazen chain heavy. Though I will call and cry out, He shuts out my prayer. He has blocked my ways and obstructed my paths; He has troubled me.
سيج علىّ حتى لا أخرج، وثقل أغلالى. دعوته فلم يستجيب لي. صرخت إليه فلم يسر بصلأتى. سيج طرقي وألوى سبلى المسلوكة.

Acs~yorter n~je oucarx ecjor. Nyof pe tafermoui~ e~roi qen pima eth/p. Af[oji n~ca v/etohi e~ratf: ouoh afraqt af,at eitak/out. Af[wlk n~tefvi] ouoh aftahoi e~rat m~v~r/] n~ouc~kopoc: eyrefhioui~ m~pefcob] e~qoun e~roi.

"He is a bear lying in wait for me like a lion in a hidden place. After I departed, He eagerly pursued and caught me; He has utterly ruined me. He bent his bow and set me up as a target for the arrow.
صار لي كدب كامن وأسد فى موضع مختفى. طاردنى وصرعنى وتركنى هالكاً. أوتر قوسه وأقامنى هدفاً ليلقى فىّ سهامه.
Afy~rouse e~qoun e~na[~lwt n~je nicoynef n~te pefc~keuoc n~hicoynef. Aiswpi n~cwbi m~palaoc t/rf: nai oi m~'almoc nwou m~pie~hoou t/rf. Aft~coi n~sasi: ouoh afy~riyaqi qen ouensasi.
"He caused the arrows of His quiver to pierce my loins. I became a laughingstock to all my people, and their song all the day. He has filled me with bitterness and drenched me with gall.
أدخل فى كليتى نبال جعبته. صرت ضحكة لكل شعبى وأغنية لهم النهار كله. جرعنى الحنظل. وأسكرنى أفسنتينا.
Ouoh afyrebio n~nanajhi qenoual n~w~ni: aftemmoi n~oukermi: Ouoh afhioui~ m~ta'u,/ e~bolqen t~hir/n/: aierp~wbs n~naa~gayon: Ouoh actako n~je tahupoc tacic: nem tahelpic e~bol hiten P[oic.

"He also broke my teeth with gravel and fed me with ashes. He took away peace from my soul, and I have forgotten the good things. Therefore I said, ‘My victory and my hope have perished from the Lord.’
هتم بالحصى أسنانى وأطعمنى الرماد. فبعدت نفسى عن السلام. ونسيت الخيرآتٍ. وباد اقنومى ورجائى من الرب.
Aierv~meui~ e~bol qen tameth/ki nem padiwgmoc: ousasi nem ouensasi cena erpameui~: ouoh e~re ta'u,/ ermeletan nem/i p~neuma eie~jem ka] qen pah/t.

"I remembered by reason of my poverty, and because of my persecution, I remembered my bitterness and gall. My soul shall remember and meditate within me. I will fix this in my heart; therefore, I will endure.
أذكر بؤسى وشقائى والافسنتين والمرارة التى لم تبرح من ذاكرتى. هذا ما تردده نفسى فى، وأشعر به فى قلبى.

It is through the mercies of the Lord that He has not failed me, because His compassions are not exhausted. Pity us, O Lord, early every month: for we are not brought to an end, because His compassions are not exhausted. They are new every morning: great is Your faithfulness. The Lord is my portion, says my soul; therefore will I wait for Him.

من أجل ذلك أرجو مراحم الرب لأنه لم يتركنى عنه. لأن رأفته لا تزول على ممر الشهور والأيام كلها. إرحمنا يارب فى فنائنا لأن رأفتك لا تفرغ. هى جديدة فى كل صباح. وعظيم هو إيمانك. قالت نفسى نصيبى هو الرب، فلذلك أرجوه.
Oua~gayoc pe P[oic n~n/e~terhupomonin e~rof: nanef gar n~]'u,/ etkw] n~cwf: Ouoh ecohi e~pioujai n~te P[oic: n~tecswpi qen ou/cu,ia~: Nanec m~pirwmi e~swp afsanfai m~pinahbef e~jwf icjen tefmeta~lou.

"The Lord is good to those who wait for Him, To the soul who will seek Him, the Good One. He will wait for and quietly expect the salvation of the Lord. It is good for a man when he takes up a yoke in his youth.
صالح هو الرب للذين يترجونه. طيب للنفس التى تطلبه. وتتوقع بسكوت خلاص الرب. جيد للرجل أن يحمل النير من منذ صبائه.
Fnahemci e~q~r/i m~mauatf: n~tef,arwf je aftalof e~jwf. f~na,arwf qen p~kahi a~r/ou n~tefjem ouhelpicp~neuma Fnariki n~tefouoji m~v/eynaraqtf e~roc: efe~ci n~s~vit.
"He will sit alone and be silent, because he bears it on himself. He will give his cheek to the one who strikes him, and he will be filled with insults.
يجلس وحده ويصمت لأنه قد وضعه عليه. يجعل فى التراب فمه لعله يجد رجاء. يميل خده لمن يلطمه ويشبع تعييراً.
Je n~nef,af n~cwf n~jeP[oic sae~neh. Je e~ne afyebiof efe~senh/t kata p~a~sai n~te pefnai: Je m~peferkouji n~h/t: ouoh afyebiof e~nis/ri n~te nirwmi.
Yet the Lord shall not reject him forever. "For He who humbles will have compassion according to the abundance of His mercy. For He does not afflict willingly, though He humbles the children of men.
إلا أن الرب لا يقصيه عنه إلى الأبد. فإنه ولو واضعه يترأف عليه ككثرة رحمته. لأنه لم يرذل من قلبه بل تواضع لبنى البشر.
Ep~jin yebio qa nef[a~lauj n~n/t/rou eym/r e~pikahi: Eriki e~bol m~p~hap n~ourwmi: mpem~yo e~bol m~p~ho m~pet[oci. Ehi ourwmi e~p~hap: qen p~jin eyref]hap e~rof: m~pefjoc n~je P[oic.
"To humble all the prisoners of the earth under His feet, "To turn aside the judgment of a man before the face of the Most High, and to condemn a man before he is judged, the Lord does not command.
ليذل تحت قدميه جميع المرتبطين بالأرض. أو حرف حكم الرجل أمام وجه العلى. وإذا نكس الإنسان فى خصومته عندما يحكم عليه أفما يقول الرب.

Nim afjoc m~pair/] ouoh afswpi: m~pefouahcahni n~je P[oic hinai. Ebolqen rwf m~pet[oci: m~paui~ e~bol n~je nipeynaneu nem nipethwou.Pwc f~na,~remrem n~je pirwmi eybe pihap n~te pefnobi efwnq n~je pirwmi.
Who thus speaks, and it comes to pass? The Lord has not commanded it, "For evil and good shall not proceed from the mouth of the Most High. Why should a living man complain, a man concerning his sin?
من ذا الذى قال فكان. والرب لم يأمر. أليس من فم العلى تخرج الخيرآتٍ والشرور. كيف يتذمر الإنسان الحي الرجل المعاقب لأجل خطيته.
Maren qotqet n~nenmwit: ouoh n~te moust n~nentatci: n~tentacyon haP[oic. Marenfai n~nenh/t nem nenjij: nahren v/et[oci etqen t~ve. Anernobi anera~ceb/c an]jwntp~neuma n~yok de m~pek,wnan e~bol.

Our way has been searched out and examined; therefore we shall turn to the Lord. "Let us lift our hearts and our hands to the Most High in heaven. We have sinned and acted in an ungodly way; thus You have not shown us mercy.
فلنفحص طرقنا ونختبر خطوآتٍنا ونرجع إلى الرب. ولنرفع قلوبنا مع الأيدي لدى العلى الذى فى السماء. قد أخطأنا ونافقنا وأغضبنا وأنت لم تغفر لنا.
Akvwrs e~bol ak[ia~ouw qen oujwnt ouoh ak[oji n~cwn akqoyben m~pek]a~co. Akvwrs n~ou[/pinak e~bol e~s~tem voh e~q~r/i harok n~je tap~roceu,/: eyriyebio e~stem nau nem e~hitt e~bol.
But You visited us in anger and drove us away. You have put us to death and not spared us. "You veiled Yourself with a cloud because of our prayer. To close my eyes and to reject me.
قد التحفت بالغضب وطردتنا وقتلتنا ولم تشفق. التحفت بغمام لئلا تبلغ إليك صلأتى. لأ تضع لكي لا أرى فأطرح.

Ak,an n~y~m/] n~nilaoc. Auouwn n~rwou e~h~r/i e~jwn n~je nenjaji t/rou. ~A ouho] nem oujwnt swpi nan: aufai m~mon ouoh auraqten. Nabal aui~ni han moumi~ e~bol n~te hanmwou: e~jen p~qomqem n~t~seri m~palaoc.

You have placed us in the midst of the peoples. All our enemies have opened their mouth against us. "Fear and anger have come upon us, Yes, devastation and destruction. My eyes will shed tears for forgiveness because of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
تركتنا فى وسط الشعوب. ففتح جميع أعدائنا أفواههم علينا فرفعونا ثم طرحونا. فحل بنا خوف وسخط. عيناي تسيل بأنهار مياه على سحق بنت شعبى.
Pabal aferm~kah n~]na,arwi an: e~s~tem fai n~jwi e~p~swi: watefjoust n~je P[oic n~tefnau e~bolqen t~ve. Pabal na] m~kah e~jen ta'u,/ para nis/ri t/rou n~te]baki.

My eyes are drowned with tears, and I will not keep silent; so there shall be no rest, until the Lord bends down and sees from heaven. My eyes will bring suffering in my soul because of all the daughters of the city.
عينىّ تسكب و لا تكف بلا انقطاع . ولا أرفع رأسى حتى يتتطلع الرب وينظر من السماء. عينى تحزن على نفسى أكثر من جميع بنى المدينة.
Qen oujwrj aujwrj e~roi: m~v~r/] n~ou[aj n~je najaji n~jinjp~neuma Auqwteb m~pawnq qen oulakkoc: ouoh auw~li n~ous~ne e~jwi: A hanmwou jws e~jen taa~ve: aijoc je af,at n~cwf.
My enemies hunted me down without cause, like a sparrow. "They put my life to death in the pit and threw a stone at me. Water flowed over my head; I said, 'I am rejected.'
قد اصطادنى أعدائى اصطياداً كعصفور بلا سبب. وقرضوا فى الجب حيأتى. وطرحوا علىّ شبكة. فاضت المياه فوق رأسى. وقلت إنه تركنى عنه.

I called on Your name, O Lord, from the lowest pit. "You heard my voice; do not hide Your ears from my supplication. You drew near at my call on the day I called upon You. You said to me, 'Do not fear.'
صرخت إليك ياربى من جب سفلى، فسمعت صوتى. لا تمل أذنك عن طلبتى. فى اليوم الذى صرخت إليك إقتربت من معونتى وقلت لي لا تخف.
Ak]hap P[oic e~nihapp~neuma n~te ta'u,/ a,cw] m~pawnj a,nau P[oic e~nas~yorter a,] hap e~pahap: Aknau e~pou[im~p~sis t/rf qen noumokmek t/rou etsope~qoun e~roi.
O Lord, You pleaded the case for my soul; You redeemed my life. "O Lord, You saw my troubles; You judged my cause. You saw all their vengeance in all their reasoning against me.
حكمت يارب لاحكام نفسى وخلصت حيأتى. نظرت يارب إلى اضطرابى وحكمت فى دعواى. رأيت إنتقامهم كله. وجميع أفكارهم علىّ.

Akcwtem e~pous~vit P[oic: noumokmek t/rou ~etauaitou e~roi m~pie~hoou t/rf Ouoh p~kim n~nic~votou n~te n/ettwounou e~h~r/i e~jwi: ouoh noumelet/ nausop e~qoun e~roi m~pie~hoou t/rf. qen poujinhemci nem poujin twoun:
You heard their taunts and all their plots against me, "And the lips of those who rose up against me, and their meditations against me all the day. Look at their eyes as they sit down and rise up.
سمعت تعييرهم يارب وكل مشوراتهم و موآمراتهم علىّ اليوم كله، وتحريك شفاة القائمين علىّ. وصرت تلاوتهم النهار كله فى جلوسهم وقيامهم.
Joust e~q~r/i e~jen noubal. Eke~]s ebiw~ nwou n~ouqici qat~jom m~pouh/t. Nyok eke~[oji n~cwou n~q~r/i qen m~bon ouoh n~te kmounkou e~bol capec/t n~t~ve P[oic.

You shall render a recompense to them, O Lord, according to the works of their hands. "You shall repay them as a covering Your hardship for them. You shall pursue them in Your wrath and utterly destroy them from under heaven, O Lord.
أنظر يارب إلى عيونهم واعطهم مجازاة بحسب أعمال أيديهم. وكافئهم بالتعب على قساوة قلوبهم. واطردهم بغضبك. وافنهم يارب من تحت السماء.
The doxology of the Twelfth Hour of Great Friday of Holy Pascha. May its blessings be with us. Amen.
تسبحة البصخة الساعة الثانية من يوم الجمعة العظيمة من البصخة المقدسة بركته علينا. آمين.

Comment.Language: The Paschal Doxology is chanted alternating one time from inside the sanctuary, and one time from outside the sanctuary, to resemble the heavenly and the earthly who were waiting the resurrection of the Lord. The deacons should wear the red “patrashel.”
The Psalm “Your Throne (Peky~ronoc)” is chanted in the “Shammy” tune while facing east:

Text.Language: Au,at qen oulakkoc efcapec/t: qen hanma n~,aki nem t~q/ibi m~v~mou.
They laid me in the lowest pit, in dark places and in the shadow of death.
جعلونى فى جب سفلى. فى مواضع مظلمة وظلال الموت.
Eswp aisanmosi qen y~m/] nt~q/ibi m~v~mou: n~naerho] qat~h/ n~han pethwou je n~yok k~,/ nem/i.
Yes, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me.
وإن سلكت فى وسط ظلال الموت فلا أخشى من الشر لأنك معى. هلليلويا.

Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; [Alleluia.]
عرشك يا الله إلى دهر الدهور. ]الليلويا.[
Ouoh pis~bwt m~p~cwouten pe p~s~bwt n~te tekmetouro. Ouc~murna nem ouc~takt/ nem oukacia~ e~bolqen nekh~bwc: all/louia.
Your royal scepter is a scepter of uprightness. Myrrh and stacte and cassia pour forth from Your garments. Alleluia.
قضيب الإستقامة هو قضيب ملكك. المر والميعة والسليخة من ثيابك. الليلويا.
Eta~rouhi de swpi afi~ n~je ourwmi n~ramao e~bolqen Arimayeac: e~pefran pe Iwc/f: vai hwf ne afermay/t/c n~I/couc.
Now when evening had come, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who himself had also become a disciple of Jesus.
ولما كان المساء جاء رجل غنى من الرامة إسمه يوسف. هذا أيضاً كان تلميذاً ليسوع.
Vai afi~ haPilatoc afere~tin m~picwma n~te I/couc tote Pilatoc afouah cahni e~t/if:
This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given to him.
فهذا جاء إلى بيلاطس وطلب جسد يسوع. فأمر بيلاطس حينئذ أن يعطى الجسد.
Ouoh af[i m~picwma n~je Iwc/f afkoulwlf qen ousentw e~couab
When Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
فأخذ يوسف الجسد ولفه بلفائف من الكتان النقى.
Ouoh af,af qen pefm~hau m~beri: v/e~taf sokf qen ]petra: ouoh afc~kerker n~ounis] n~w~ni e~rwf m~pim~hau afhwl:
And laid it in his new tomb which he had hewn out of the rock; and he rolled a large stone against the door of the tomb, and departed.
ووضعه فى قبره الجديد الذى كان قد نحته فى الصخرة. ثم دحرج حجراً عظيماً على باب القبر ومضى.
Nac,/ de m~mau n~je Maria ]Magdalin/: nem ]ke Maria euhemci m~pem~yo m~pim~hau.
And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.
وكانت هناك مريم المجدلية ومريم الآخرى جالستين تجاه القبر.
Ouoh h/d/et a~r~ouhi swpi epid/ net~parackeu/~ te etqajwf m~picabbaton:
Now when evening had come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
ولما كان المساء ولأنها كانت الجمعة التى هى قبل السبت،
Etfai n~je Iwc/f e~bolqen Arimayeac: e~oueuc~,emwn pe m~bouleut/c: vai e~te n~yof hwf nafjoust e~bol qat~h/ n~]metouro n~te Vnou]: afertolman afse e~qoun haPilatoc afere~tin mp~cwma n~I/couc.
Joseph of Arimathea, a prominent council member, who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God, coming and taking courage, went in to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
جاء يوسف الذى من الرامة. وكان شريفاً ذا مشورة. وكان هو أيضاً يترجى ملكوت الله. فتجاسر ودخل إلى بيلاطس وطلب جسد يسوع.
PiLatoc de afers~v/ri je h/d/ afmou ouoh e~tafmou] e~pie~katontar,oc afsenf: je an afouw~ afmou:
Pilate marveled that He was already dead; and summoning the centurion, he asked him if He had been dead for some time.
فتعجب بيلاطس إنه مات هكذا سريعاً. فإستدعى قائد المئة وسأله هل له زمان قد مات.
Ouoh e~tafe~mi e~bolhitotf mpie~katontar,oc: af] m~picwma n~te I/couc n~Iwc/f.
So when he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.
ولما عرف من قائد المئة، وهب جسد يسوع ليوسف.

Then he bought fine linen, took Him down, and wrapped Him in the linen. And he laid Him in a tomb which had been hewn out of the rock, and rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
فإشترى يوسف لفافة من الكتان وأنزله ولفه بها. ووضعه فى قبر كان منحوتاً فى صخرة. ودحرج حجراً على باب القبر.
Ouoh afc~kerker n~ouw~ni e~rwf m~pimhau Maria ]Magdalin/ nem Maria n~te Iwc/: naunau je au,af ywn.
And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses observed where He was laid.
وكانت مريم المجدلية ومريم أم يوسي تنظران أين وضع.
Ouoh e~tafswpi n~je picabbaton: Maria }magdalin/ nem Maria n~te Iakwboc nem Calwme: auswpi n~hanc~yoinoufi hina n~toui~ n~touyahcf.
Now when the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices, that they might come and anoint Him.
ولما مضى السبت. إشترت مريم المجدلية ومريم أم يعقوب وسالومة حنوطاً ليأتين ويحنطنه.

ol.li: Meanwhile, the priest wraps the icon of the burial in a white linen veil, places a cross on it and places it on the Southern side of the Altar (the right-side of the Altar with respect to the congregation facing the East).
He then “buries” it amidst the roses and spices and covers it with a white veil.
The priest then places 2 candles or oil lamps on either side of (longitudinally) to resemble the 2 angels that were at the tomb of Christ, one at His head and the other at His feet.
The priest chants Psalms 1, 2 and 3 until the verse “I have laid down and slept.” (Ps. 3:2).
